pages.text: $(#DAA520)$(l)【Glacial Nectar】$()$(br2)“A golden root slumbering beneath the snow, carrying vitality and hope.”$(br2)Astragalus takes root in the frigid tundra, resilient against the cold. Even under raging blizzards, it survives. Its roots are rich in nutrients and have long been regarded as a treasured tonic by the northern nomads. Legends tell that in freezing winter nights, warriors who drank astragalus-infused broth could stave off hunger and restore their weary bodies.
Grows in tundras and frozen lands—only extreme cold can nurture its golden roots. Astragalus quietly thrives beneath the snow, waiting for spring to return before sprouting anew.

Excerpt from *The Northern Survival Chronicles*$(br)“A winter hunter, weakened by starvation and cold, collapsed. The chieftain boiled astragalus root into a broth and fed him. Within moments, color returned to his face, and strength flowed back into his limbs.”

Slowly simmered astragalus root produces a golden-hued tea with a mild herbal sweetness. Upon drinking, hunger fades instantly, and warmth returns to the body.$(br2)$(#B8860B)Yet there is a saying—those who indulge too greedily in its nourishing power may one day be reclaimed by the earth…$()
